title: Hermeneutic Phenomenological Approach for Innovating Video Game-Based Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Corporate training planning and technology integration experience, foundational curriculum design knowledge
context.additional_context: Innovative exploration of video games as educational tools for corporate managers/leaders, analyzing real-world applications and challenges via hermeneutic phenomenological methodology.

learning_goals: Learners can propose three or more practical strategies for integrating video game content into curriculum design
Participants can develop a framework for analyzing stakeholder experiences in technology integration projects using hermeneutic phenomenological approaches
Instructional designers can develop tools to evaluate the motivational effects of content elements (e.g., narrative, simulation) beyond 'gameplay' in game-based learning
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
